thread.title: Newton harriers compete at middle school state cross country meet
thread.title_full: Newton harriers compete at middle school state cross country meet

title: Newton harriers compete at middle school state cross country meet
text:
Newton harriers compete at middle school state cross country meet Published: Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 11:15 a.m. CDT • Updated: Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 12:13 p.m. CDT Caption (Submitted photo) Newton’s Berg Middle School had five runners compete in the 2015 Iowa Middle School state cross country meet Saturday in Ankeny. The four girls were, from left, Jenna Smith, Abby Altman, Tes Schuster and Meg Callaghan. Not pictured: Anthony Bestell, who was the lone Newton boy competing. By Jocelyn Sheets Newton Daily News 
ANKENY — Newton’s Berg Middle School cross country runners competed in Saturday’s 2015 Iowa Middle School State cross country meet to claim three medals in three of the four races in Class 3A. Medals were awarded to the top 50 runners in each race. 
Newton’s Abby Altman, Jenna Smith and Tes Schuster ran in the eighth-grade girls 2-mile race at state and posted personal-best times. Altman earned the 27th-place medal in 13 minutes, 24 seconds. Smith finished 58th in 14:28, and Schuster took 61st in 14:42. There were 79 runners in the 3A eighth-grade girls’ race. 
The seventh-grade girls’ race in the 3A division had 60 girls competing. Newton’s Meg Callaghan captured the 18th-place medal in a personal-best time of 13:36. 
Newton’s lone boy competing was Anthony Bestell in the seventh-grade race with a field of 74 runners. Bestell collected the 43rd-place medal in 13:36. 
Contact Jocelyn Sheets at 641-792-3121 ext. 6535 or jsheets@newtondailynews.com
